review_title: If you are thinking about working for them, dint.

pros: Friendly employees from CEO to part-time staff, helping those in need, great work\life balance.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Las Vegas, NV
cons: Aside from the low salary, and the amount of those calls responsibility you have in your shoulders, the appointments call center provides poor training, no support, and they're a bunch of unprofessional ladies talking bad about the employees, that you can hear them behind doors, they keep their doors close, so you can never get support.

review_title: Great people, but the company outsources jobs.
cons: This company outsources jobs frequently. I had to change positions within the company twice due to outsourcing to India.

job_title: Leadership Role in Las Vegas, NV
pros: I have worked at NVHC for 6 months. I am so impressed with the people that work here! They genuinely care about each others success. The senior leaders genuinely care about employees and creating a culture where patients can receive the best care. It is day and night better than where I came from where the priority was 100% about profit. Decisions at NVHC are mission driven. I am so happy to work here and see myself here for long-term!
cons: Nothing major at all...seriously. It's a great place!

review_title: The salary it does not compensate the importance of the resposabilities and the pressure you get from management
job_title: Call Center Representative in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Health Benefits, and earned time off are pretty reasonable
cons: Poor training and lack of support as a new team member.

job_title: Senior RN Manager in Carson City, NV
pros: All the benefits of working for a Federally Qualified Health Center.
cons: All the cons of working for a non-profit Federally Qualified Health Center.

pros: NVHC walks its talk. I have been at the company for nearly three years, and I love the people I work with, respect the teamwork and passion, and believe in what I'm doing every day - bringing quality healthcare to those who may not have access to it due to hardship, travel, lifestyle or the many, many obstacles that life throws in our way every day.  They offer company-paid medical, dental and vision insurance, paid life insurance, a great culture, holiday parties and events.
cons: I can sometimes feel separated from the patient experience, being in an administrative role, so I try to connect with patient stories when I can, to remind myself of why I chose to work at NVHC, and why I support our employees to help them do the quality work they do every day. As a non-profit, they pay well considering.

review_title: Think Carefully Before They Are Part of Your Resume
pros: Nice new building.  Good special events parties. Somewhat community oriented. Some good, conscientious people working there. Computerized ID cards made life easier.
cons: Top executive management is difficult to deal with.  Not user friendly. Extremely self conscious of employees not following chain of command in just voicing an opinion in meetings.  A lot of write ups on employees, even after they have left the company. Top executives will not let the employees make the decisions they were hired to do. Everything must go to the top first. Frustrating to watch other fellow employees have to try to work through this. If you have to work late, you might run the risk of getting mugged in the parking lot at some of these buildings. Not enough staff to cover company mandated work load.

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Carson City, NV
pros: Good hours good days off. Good company to work for
cons: Pay is low for the field
